title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Scientific fraud has become an ‘industry,’ alarming analysis finds
items.description: Sophisticated global networks are infiltrating journals to publish fake papers

items.title: Why a top economist discounts Trump’s claim U.S. jobs data are ‘rigged’
items.description: A former head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics rebuts reason why president fired the agency’s leader

items.title: Immune-dodging cells could give diabetes treatment a shot in the arm
items.description: In first human test, genetically modified pancreas cells injected into patient’s arm evade immune attack, produce insulin

items.title: Mysterious killer of sea stars finally identified
items.description: Discovery of a bacterium could reveal more about massive die-off, perhaps aid recovery

items.title: One-fifth of computer science papers may include AI content
items.description: A surge in AI-generated text has been detected in papers across many disciplines since the release of ChatGPT

items.title: Simple solar device extracts ammonia from wastewater
items.description: Technique could provide cheap fertilizer and prevent harmful nutrient runoff

items.title: NSF and NIH suspend grants to UCLA
items.description: Move follows Trump administration finding that school didn’t effectively combat antisemitism

items.title: Ecuador eliminates science agency in major reorganization
items.description: Plan to revamp research and merge environment and energy ministries sparks concern

items.title: Blood taken from Danish babies ended up in huge genetic study—without consent
items.description: The iPsych project, which investigates the genetics of psychiatric disorders, has sent 140,000 opt-out notices amid backlash

items.title: With boost to NIH budget, Senate panel rejects Trump’s plan to slash agency
items.description: Republicans on spending committee push back against proposed reorganization and overhead cuts
